trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Zoom | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Zoom | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Zoom with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Zoom with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Zoom.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Zoom.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Zoom tenant
trans-unit.target: A Zoom tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Zoom will be able to single sign into the application at your Zoom company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Zoom will be able to single sign into the application at your Zoom company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Zoom
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Zoom

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Zoom.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Zoom.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Zoom.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Zoom.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Zoom, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Zoom, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Zoom</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Zoom</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Zoom with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Zoom with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Zoom application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Zoom application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Zoom page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Zoom page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Zoom Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.zoom.us", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Zoom Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.zoom.us", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Zoom page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Zoom page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Zoom company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Zoom company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click the Single Sign-On tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Single Sign-On tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Security Control tab, and then go to the Single Sign-On settings.
trans-unit.target: Click the Security Control tab, and then go to the Single Sign-On settings.

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-On section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-On section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoom dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-in page URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoom dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-in page URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoom dialog page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-out page URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoom dialog page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the Sign-out page URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Identity provider certificate textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Identity provider certificate textbox

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoom dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoom dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Zoom, they must be provisioned into Zoom.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Zoom, they must be provisioned into Zoom.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Zoom, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Zoom, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Zoom company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Zoom company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click the Account Management tab, and then click User Management.
trans-unit.target: Click the Account Management tab, and then click User Management.

trans-unit.source: In the User Management section, click Add users.
trans-unit.target: In the User Management section, click Add users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>User management</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>User management</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Add users page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Add users page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As User Type, select Basic.
trans-unit.target: As User Type, select Basic.

trans-unit.source: In the Emails textbox, type the email address of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Emails textbox, type the email address of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Zoom user account creation tools or APIs provided by Zoom to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Zoom user account creation tools or APIs provided by Zoom to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Zoom **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Zoom **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
